abstract: The latest patent dispute pits Apple, Google and Napster against a company that closed five years ago.
snippet: The latest patent dispute pits Apple, Google and Napster against a company that closed five years ago.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 2 — In 1997, Jonathan T. Taplin, a veteran film and television producer, stood up at a cable industry convention and asserted that in the future all movies would be distributed over the Internet. He recalls being laughed out of the room.

headline.main: Patent Lawsuit Names Leading Technology Firms
headline.print_headline: Copyright Lawsuit Names Leading Technology Firms

byline.original: By John Markoff and Miguel Helft
